trans-unit.source: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a set of system table expressions which you can use to obtain diagnostic information about the state of the database and about the database sessions.

seg-source.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a set of system table expressions which you can use to obtain diagnostic information about the state of the database and about the database sessions.

target.mrk: <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> provides a set of system table expressions which you can use to obtain diagnostic information about the state of the database and about the database sessions.

trans-unit.source: There are two types of diagnostic table expressions in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>:

seg-source.mrk: There are two types of diagnostic table expressions in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>:

target.mrk: There are two types of diagnostic table expressions in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>:

trans-unit.source: Tables that are like any other table in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. You can specify the diagnostic table name anywhere a normal table name is allowed.

seg-source.mrk: Tables that are like any other table in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
You can specify the diagnostic table name anywhere a normal table name is allowed.

target.mrk: Tables that are like any other table in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
You can specify the diagnostic table name anywhere a normal table name is allowed.

trans-unit.source: Functions that are like any other function in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>. Diagnostic table functions can accept zero or more arguments, depending on the table function that you use. You must use the SQL-defined table function syntax to access these functions.

seg-source.mrk: Functions that are like any other function in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
Diagnostic table functions can accept zero or more arguments, depending on the table function that you use.
You must use the SQL-defined table function syntax to access these functions.

target.mrk: Functions that are like any other function in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.
Diagnostic table functions can accept zero or more arguments, depending on the table function that you use.
You must use the SQL-defined table function syntax to access these functions.

target.mrk: The following table shows the types and names of the diagnostic table expressions in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: This table lists the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> diagnostic table expressions and their types (either table or table function).

seg-source.mrk: This table lists the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> diagnostic table expressions and their types (either table or table function).

target.mrk: This table lists the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> diagnostic table expressions and their types (either table or table function).

trans-unit.source: If you reference a diagnostic table in a DDL statement or a compression procedure, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.

seg-source.mrk: If you reference a diagnostic table in a DDL statement or a compression procedure, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.

target.mrk: If you reference a diagnostic table in a DDL statement or a compression procedure, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.
